title: The Adventures of Trent Long: Salesman by Day, Hero by Night
summary: Trent Long discovers his superpower of persuasive influence, using it to battle corporate greed while balancing his life as a sales trainer.
summaryGerman: Trent Long entdeckt seine Superkraft der überzeugenden Einflussnahme und verwendet sie, um die Unternehmensgier zu bekämpfen, während er sein Leben als Verkaufstrainer ausbalanciert.
summaryDutch: Trent Long ontdekt zijn superkracht van overtuigende invloed en gebruikt deze om bedrijfsgreed te bestrijden terwijl hij zijn leven als verkooptrainer in evenwicht houdt.
summaryFrench: Trent Long découvre son super-pouvoir d'influence persuasive et l'utilise pour lutter contre la cupidité des entreprises tout en équilibrant sa vie de formateur commercial.

story.text: Trent Long starts his week feeling energized. While instructing a sales seminar, he inadvertently discovers he can influence people's decisions with just his words.
Trent tests his new-found ability on small scales, subtly steering his clients towards more ethical purchasing decisions. The feeling of using his power for good is exhilarating.
A mysterious figure approaches Trent, warning him that his powers could de destabilizing. Trent feels an eerie chill as he ponders the implications.
Determined to master his abilities, Trent spends the day researching and practicing. He resolves to only use his powers for the betterment of society.
A local business tycoon learns of Trent's abilities and attempts to hire him for a massive, unethical sales campaign. Trent declines, reinforcing his moral stance.
In a bold move, Trent decides to expose the tycoon's exploitative practices. He orchestrates a massive information leak, and the public outcry is immediate.
As the week closes, Trent reflects on his actions and the chaotic week. He feels hopeful, knowing he has made a difference.

ending: As Trent Long looked over the city he had vowed to protect, he knew that this was just the beginning.
moral: True power lies in using one's abilities for the greater good, not personal gain.
